definition: to put in detention (a soldier, a pupil)
mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve
to close/to stop up/to shut/to obstruct

sentences.english: I overheard that my confinement was due to the power of 'allergies.
sentences.chinese: 我还偷听到，是我的致过敏能力导致我被关禁闭。

sentences.english: You want a burger or you want to go to the SHU?
sentences.chinese: 你想要汉堡包还是想被关禁闭？

sentences.english: Tess: Actually I could, and I would do it without getting a detention.
sentences.chinese: 事实上我可以，而且我根本不会被关禁闭。

sentences.english: Prisoners may be sentenced to detention for as much as three months.
sentences.chinese: 囚犯们可能会被关禁闭长达三个月之久。

sentences.english: Scofield and Fernando were all in the solitary room.
sentences.chinese: 斯科非尔德和费尔南多都还在关禁闭。

sentences.english: If you continue with this you'll stay grounded for good.
sentences.chinese: 如果你们继续冥顽不化，你们会被永久关禁闭。

sentences.english: If a student refuses to accept the detention, they will be expelled .
sentences.chinese: 如果一个学生拒绝接收关禁闭，他们将会被开除。

sentences.english: Now Sasha and Malia aren't here tonight because they're grounded.
sentences.chinese: 啊，萨莎和玛丽亚今晚来不了，因为她们被关禁闭了。

sentences.english: The punishment for such a crime can range from getting thrown into the SHU to getting a couple years added onto a sentence.
sentences.chinese: 这种罪行的惩罚是被关禁闭或在服刑期上加几年。

sentences.english: dissent will be punished with beatings and solitary confinement;
sentences.chinese: 否则就会被痛揍并被单独关禁闭。

definition: to face the wall and ponder about one's misdeeds/to stand in the corner (punishment)/(fig.) to examine one's conscience

to forbid sb to go out/to confine to one location (e.g. student, soldier, prisoner, monk etc)/to ground (as disciplinary measure)/to gate/to curfew/restriction on movement/ban on visiting a place/out of bounds/off limits/caveat
shut oneself up and ponder over one's mistakes
to be made to stand still as a punishment
to eliminate/to sack/to remove from office
to break the law/to commit a crime
